posts.post_content: @arglypuff, no, he's saying that during your untap step, untap your lands, and then during your upkeep step play this and then your draw step, draw it. That way you can play this and have the fetched enchantment in the same turn.

@arglypuff, no, he's saying that during your untap step, untap your lands, and then during your upkeep step play this and then your draw step, draw it. That way you can play this and have the fetched enchantment in the same turn.

posts.post_content:
Such an amazing card, and it's legacy legal! Awesome targets: Humility, Moat, Opalescence (or other such cards in a Replenish deck), and any artifact/enchant that can be run in a silver bullet strategy.  
  
Did I mention it happens at instant speed so you can play it during your upkeep, so you can untap your lands, play, and then draw it for your card for the turn?
posts.html:
Such an amazing card, and it's legacy legal! Awesome targets: Humility, Moat, Opalescence (or other such cards in a Replenish deck), and any artifact/enchant that can be run in a silver bullet strategy.

Did I mention it happens at instant speed so you can play it during your upkeep, so you can untap your lands, play, and then draw it for your card for the turn?

posts.post_content:
Play at end of opponents turn, during your upkeep or have a draw mechanic. It's remarkably useful even when playing only artifacts or only enchantments.  
  
Currently running it in a creature deck that has various enchantments that I can't I can't run too many multiples of. [Pestilence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence), [Angelic Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Destiny) and [Cover of Darkness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cover of Darkness) being the most picked ones.

Posted By: Dankirk (11/4/2012 1:06:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I typically use this to find Splinter Twin, a common win condition in my [Numot, the Devastator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Numot, the Devastator) EDH. However, there's a good number of other things it can grab depending on the situation. Removal, such as [Dispeller's Capsule](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dispeller's Capsule), [Confiscate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confiscate), and [Soul Snare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Snare).  
  
I had a situation yesterday where it was still my upkeep, my opponent controlled a [Skithyrix, the Blight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skithyrix, the Blight) Dragon that had hit me twice, and I had just *Forecasted* [Sky Hussar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sky Hussar) into this. I had completely forgotten about the [Confiscate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confiscate) that was in my deck and could have let me last at least another turn, and elected not to cast the tutor. I topdecked a [plains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=plains). I was forced to play Sky Hussar as a blocker. If I had more practice with my EDH, that misplay probably could have been avoided, but I realize that was a moot point then as my opponent flashed me the [Dia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dia)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I typically use this to find Splinter Twin, a common win condition in my Numot, the Devastator EDH. However, there's a good number of other things it can grab depending on the situation. Removal, such as Dispeller's Capsule, Confiscate, and Soul Snare.

I had a situation yesterday where it was still my upkeep, my opponent controlled a Skithyrix, the Blight Dragon that had hit me twice, and I had just Forecasted Sky Hussar into this. I had completely forgotten about the Confiscate that was in my deck and could have let me last at least another turn, and elected not to cast the tutor. I topdecked a plains. I was forced to play Sky Hussar as a blocker. If I had more practice with my EDH, that misplay probably could have been avoided, but I realize that was a moot point then as my opponent flashed me the Dia... (see all)
